definition: cat/CL:隻|只[zhi1]/(dialect) to hide oneself/(coll.) modem
cat/CL:隻|只[zhi1]/(dialect) to hide oneself/(coll.) modem

sentences.english: Why don't violists play hide and seek?
sentences.chinese: 为什么中提琴手不玩躲猫猫？

sentences.english: Adam and Eve played the first game of hide and seek.
sentences.chinese: 亚当和夏娃是“躲猫猫”游戏的鼻祖。

sentences.english: Reading was my favorite activity, closely followed by “playing pretend” outside.
sentences.chinese: 读书是我的最爱，紧紧排在户外“躲猫猫游戏”之后。

sentences.english: So there's no reason to run and hide yet.
sentences.chinese: 所以还没有理由躲猫猫。

sentences.english: How do you defeat the hiding syndrome? Here are some thoughts
sentences.chinese: 你该如何战胜躲猫猫综合症？

sentences.english: Nothing defeats hiding like seeking God together.
sentences.chinese: 若非一起寻求神，就没人能战胜躲猫猫综合症。

sentences.english: There is a peek-a-boo community, whose head has not been found yet.
sentences.chinese: 有一个躲猫猫社团，他们的团长现在还没找到。

sentences.english: When women were babies, they enjoyed playing peek-a-boo with their fathers.
sentences.chinese: 在女人年幼时，她们很喜欢和父亲玩躲猫猫的游戏。

sentences.english: My cousins and I usually played it just before dark.
sentences.chinese: 我和我表弟们经常玩躲猫猫到天黑才罢休。

sentences.english: He wants you and your mate hiding from one another.
sentences.chinese: 他正希望你俩互相躲猫猫呢。

definition: to play/to have fun/to trifle with/toy/sth used for amusement/curio or antique (Taiwan pr. [wan4])/to keep sth for entertainment
to act shamelessly/to refuse to acknowledge that one has lost the game, or made a promise etc/to act dumb/to act as if sth never happened
to play/to have fun/to hang out
to play (as children do)/to amuse oneself
to play rubber band jump rope
to cause trouble/to stir up trouble
